name: Cornmeal / Polenta
properties: Blue cornmeal available with additional antioxidants
Used for coating, crusting, and as a grain base
Adds texture and helps create crispy coatings
Can be stone-ground for maximum nutrition
benefits: Cornmeal/polenta is a whole grain corn product that provides fiber and, when blue, additional anthocyanin antioxidants. It's versatile for creating crispy coatings on tempeh and vegetables, or can be cooked into a creamy porridge. Blue cornmeal offers enhanced antioxidant content compared to yellow varieties.
amount: 1/3 to 3/4 cup coarse-ground cornmeal for coating or crusting (4 servings)

quotes: 1/3 cup/40g coarse cornmeal/polenta, blue if available - Sage-Kissed Sweet Potato Wedges with Shallots (page 208)
In a small bowl, combine the cornmeal/polenta, paprika and sage (page 208)
3/4 cup/90g coarse-ground cornmeal/polenta, blue if available - Cornmeal-Crusted Buffalo Tempeh (page 216)

In a large bowl, combine the cornmeal/polenta, nutritional yeast, garlic powder and Dr Greger's Special Spice Blend. Stream in 3/4 cup/175ml of water and whisk until smooth. Add the tempeh to the batter, turning to coat each piece (page 217)
